meanings.definition: Showing excessive reverence or worship for books.
meanings.sent1: She was so bibliolatrous that she treated her favorite book like a sacred object.
meanings.sent2: The bibliolatrous student spent hours in the library, surrounded by stacks of books.
meanings.sent3: The bibliolatrous librarian jokingly bowed down to the book return slot every evening.
meanings.sent4: Her bibliolatrous love for books was like a burning flame that never dimmed.
meanings.sent5: The bibliolatrous devotion to books was evident in the way she carefully dusted each one on her shelf.

meanings.sent1: The bibliolatrous professor had a personal library that filled an entire room.
meanings.sent2: His bibliolatrous nature was evident in the way he always carried a book with him.
meanings.sent3: The bibliolatrous book club met every week, each member bringing stacks of books to discuss.
meanings.sent4: Her bibliolatrous dedication to reading was like a never-ending journey through different worlds.
meanings.sent5: The bibliolatrous passion for books burned brightly in his eyes whenever he talked about his favorite authors.
